bill_title: allow for an affirmative defense of driving under the influence of prescription drugs in certain cases.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to allow for an affirmative defense of driving under the influence of prescription drugs in certain cases. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 32-23-6 be amended to read as follows: 32-23-6. The fact that any person charged with a violation of § 32-23-1 is or has been prescribed a drug under the laws of this state is not a an affirmative defense against any charge of violating § 32-23-1. If the person raises an affirmative defense pursuant to this section, the burden is on the state to prove beyond a reasonable doubt that the prescription drug impaired the defendant's ability to drive. 170 copies were printed on recycled paper by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.098 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
